title: No Doubt Is Playing Las Vegas‚Äô Sphere: Here‚Äôs How to Score¬†Tickets
summary: The band went on hiatus in the mid-2010s.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. You read that right. After almost a decade apart, No Doubt is back. The band is set to play 12 shows that will run in May at the Sphere in Las Vegas, visible from the glitzy Las Vegas Strip . First reported by TMZ , this stint will make singer Gwen Stefani the first woman to headline the 17,600-seat arena. Since opening in late 2023, the arena has hosted the likes of U2, Dead & Company, Eagles, Backstreet Boys and more. The news of the band’s reunion at the Sphere was posted to the venue’s Instagram on Oct. 10 along with the caption, “Remain seated, please. Permanecer sentados, por favor. Welcome to the Vegas skyline. üçäüëë We are pleased to announce our limited engagement run, No Doubt Live @SphereVegas , May 2026.” View this post on Instagram A post shared by No Doubt (@nodoubt) If you’re pumped for the band’s reunion, you can shop tickets for their upcoming shows at the Sphere below. title: Sony Xperia 1 VIII surfaces for the first time
summary: Here are the model numbers for the Xperia 1 VIII.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The Sony Xperia 1 VIII has been spotted in a database for eSIM-compatible phones. The model numbers are PM-1521-BV, PM-1522-BV, and PM-1523-BV. These model numbers are likely for the phone and its variants rather than three different models. There was a time when the fate of the Xperia line felt like it was up in the air, as it seemed the company was readying an exit from the mobile phone sector. However, Sony‚Äôs CFO confirmed that the firm still plans to support Xperia phones. Qualcomm also mentioned Sony as one of the manufacturers that will be taking advantage of its latest processor. As further proof that the Xperia line continues on, the company‚Äôs next Android flagship was recently spotted on a database. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: How Steve Martin & Alison Brown Accidentally Made a Star-Studded, Eclectic Bluegrass Album: ‚ÄòIt Was Incredibly¬†Organic‚Äô
summary: The Grammy-winning banjoists welcome fellow artists including Vince Gill, Indigo Girls, Jackson Browne and more on the new project.
body: Banjoists Alison Brown and Steve Martin‚Äôs first collaborative album, Safe, Sensible and Sane, comes out today on Brown‚Äôs Compass Records, but the pair never intended to make a full-fledged album ‚Äî let alone a star-studded project. ‚ÄúIt was incredibly organic,‚Äù Brown said, seated backstage with Martin as the two prepared to co-host the International Bluegrass Music Association (IBMA) Awards last month in Chattanooga, Tennessee. ‚ÄúWe just kept writing songs, and then at one point we realized we had enough songs to put a bow around it to make a record.‚Äù The two had previously collaborated on ‚ÄúFoggy Morning Breaking,‚Äù an interpretive tribute to Earl Scruggs‚Äô classic, which was included on Brown‚Äôs 2023 album On Banjo and spent 13 weeks at No. 1 on Bluegrass Today ‚Äôs Grassicana chart. ‚ÄúIt was really just us communicating by text and working it out,‚Äù Martin recalled. ‚ÄúShe sent me this beautiful music, and asked, ‚ÄòCan you write a few bars?‚Äô So, I worked on that. We put the song out, and it went to No. 1. And that kind of made me feel like, ‚ÄòWow, a No. 1 bluegrass song,‚Äô so then we wrote ‚ÄòBluegrass Radio‚Äô [featured on Safe, Sensible and Sane ], about a guy who is so happy that his song went ‚Ä¶

Super early bird pricing will be available for 30 days, and shipping starts at the end of November. AYANEO made big waves when it announced its first truly affordable device, the Pocket AIR Mini. It combines the company‚Äôs boutique design chops with a price that‚Äôs extremely competitive in the Android gaming handheld market, and starting today, you can finally buy one. Or at least, you can pre-order one. The Indiegogo campaign kicked off this morning, and as of writing, it‚Äôs already racked up over $50,000 in orders. The device was a big seller when it launched in China last month, so expect that number to climb over the weekend and beyond.

title: A clever USB hack might just save QPR2 Beta 3 testers from their bootloops
summary: QPR2 Beta 3 testers are going to ridiculous lengths save their phones.
body: TL;DR Google has pulled Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 due to the risk of it bootlooping phones with desktop settings enabled. Users who already installed the update have been looking for solutions to escape the loop without a factory reset. A method involving plugging and unplugging USB peripherals has proved fruitful, but can be very slow to get results. Trying out beta software means accepting some level of risk, but how much do you really expect to break when running an Android beta? Maybe Google Wallet stops working? Fingerprint sensor shuts down? A few app crashes, sure, but most of the time Google still manages to give us a largely functional piece of software. That may be true, but this week was apparently the exception that proves the rule, as Google was forced to pump the brakes on Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 following reports of some seriously phone-breaking glitches. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Get a load of One UI 8.5‚Äôs flashy new lock screen media animation
summary: Whoosh!
body: TL;DR A new animation that plays when skipping tracks from the lock screen in Samsung One UI 8.5 has appeared on Twitter. One UI 8.5 is not officially released yet and this animation is subject to change. A beta program for One UI 8.5 is expected to begin in the coming weeks. We‚Äôve seen a lot of One UI 8.5 in recent weeks, stemming from leaked builds that have made their way out ahead of an official beta reportedly starting before the end of the year . Early this morning, a splashy new lock screen media animation from an in-progress One UI 8.5 build surfaced on Twitter. A video shared by Tarun Vats on Twitter demonstrates the new effect on a phone running One UI 8.5. When tapping to skip forward or back, large album art fades from one album to the next, along with a sort of wipe effect that expands from one or two seemingly random spots within the frame.

title: This tiny clamshell might be your next EDC gaming handheld
summary: The miniature Game Boy Advance SP clone is launching this weekend.
body: TL;DR The Miyoo Mini Flip is a new clamshell gaming handheld with a tiny form factor. It has the same 2.8-inch screen as the Miyoo Mini, another very popular handheld. Orders start October 19 at 8 PM PT, although full pricing and specs are not yet available. The Game Boy Advance SP was the original clamshell EDC, and countless gaming handhelds have been chasing that high ever since. Earlier this year, the Miyoo Flip tried and mostly failed due to a seriously compromised hinge design. Now the company is back with an even smaller version, and hopefully it‚Äôs learned from the previous release. The Miyoo Mini Flip has the same 2.8-inch screen as 2021‚Äôs Miyoo Mini, but apart from that, the company hasn‚Äôt announced specs or pricing. It‚Äôs almost certainly going to be a low-powered Linux device, most likely topping off at PS1 emulation.

Most Android flagships look and feel the same these days, and unless you‚Äôre dabbling with foldables, it might be hard to get excited. However, occasionally, some OEMs experiment with the CMF of their phones, giving us some radically different smartphones that stand out from the crowd. The upcoming Redmi K90 Pro Max is one of those radically different phones that not only adopts a denim-like texture, but could also seemingly pack a rear-firing, Bose-tuned speaker. title: It‚Äôs several months later and I still hate split notifications on my Android phone
summary: My phone doesn't let me choose the notifications panel I prefer and it's endlessly frustrating.
body: There have been many times that Android phones have copied UI elements that were first introduced on iPhones. I‚Äôm not usually that picky about these features since I frequently switch between Android phone brands and have become used to differing approaches. The exception, however, is when it comes to UI elements that affect the way I use my phone. It‚Äôs why I still use navigation buttons on every phone, rather than gestures. Split notifications are another development I‚Äôm not fond of ‚Äî but my most recent device gave me no choice.

title: Here‚Äôs when Samsung will ditch Microsoft for photo backups
summary: Samsung reportedly marks April 11, 2026, as breakup day for One UI Gallery and OneDrive.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung‚Äôs Gallery app will reportedly stop syncing with OneDrive on April 11, 2026. Users will be encouraged to move their photo backups to Samsung Cloud instead. The change strengthens Samsung‚Äôs ecosystem as it phases out Microsoft integration. Samsung‚Äôs plan to end OneDrive integration in its Gallery app now has a date. According to a screenshot shared by X user Nirmal Sri , the feature is set to stop working on April 11, 2026. Once the cutoff arrives, users will no longer be able to sync their photos or videos from Samsung Gallery directly to OneDrive, with the company steering them toward Samsung Cloud instead. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Samsung is having an identity crisis
summary: Anything you can do, I can do better.
body: Yesterday, a report out of South Korea dropped a bombshell for Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 lineup. According to the report, Samsung has canceled its upcoming Galaxy S26 Edge and will release the Galaxy S26 Plus instead. The Edge was supposed to replace the Plus in next year‚Äôs Galaxy S family, but those plans are now apparently scrapped. The report cites extremely low sales of the Galaxy S25 Edge as the reason for the S26 Edge‚Äôs cancellation. This isn‚Äôt the first time we‚Äôve heard of poor Edge sales , and Samsung seemingly doesn‚Äôt want to risk repeating itself in 2026.

The OnePlus Ace 6 is widely expected to be rebranded as the OnePlus 15R for international markets. Both phones are rumored to launch internationally on November 13, 2025. title: Heading home? Google Maps might tell you how long it‚Äôll take before you even ask
summary: You know the way to your place, but this change would let you get a sense of how long the drive will take at a glance.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A user noticed Google Maps showing a live travel time in the Home chip below the search bar. The chip appears when you‚Äôre not at home, but this is the first time we‚Äôve seen it display a travel time. It could help you keep in mind when to start driving when you know the route but not the traffic situation. Google Maps looks set to make it even simpler to keep track of how far you are from home. At least one user has spotted that the app now shows your estimated travel time directly in the Home chip below the search bar, potentially avoiding the need to open the route preview or start navigation.

title: Nest speakers start showing some new color ‚Äî is Gemini to thank?
summary: Multicolor light effects have just started appearing up on Nest speakers, right in time for the Gemini preview.
body: TL;DR Nest speakers are getting a Gemini overhaul, with early access beginning this month. Nest speakers have featured a four-light display that‚Äôs so far been mostly white. Users are now sharing reports of those lights changing to a multi-colored rainbow. Nest speakers are in the middle of a big change right now, and its name is Gemini. Back at the start of the month, Google didn‚Äôt just introduce the upcoming Google Home Speaker , but confirmed that early access previews of Gemini on existing Nest speaker hardware would commence later in October. title: The Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 update has gone MIA
summary: The update has a bug that causes the SystemUI to crash.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Google recently released Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 for eligible Pixel devices. Now, it appears the tech giant may have pulled the update. The reason could be related to bootlooping issues caused by desktop mode. Yesterday, Google released the third and final beta of Android 16 QPR2 for eligible Pixel devices. This update resolves several issues, such as home screen shortcuts appearing as gray circles, selected themes not being applied on the first attempt, and Google Play System updates failing to install. If you waited on installing Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 , it looks like you‚Äôll have to continue waiting. Google may have pulled the update. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Gemini can basically use Google Sheets for you now
summary: Google says this will 'save valuable time in your workday,' so you can... do more spreadsheets, probably?
body: TL;DR Gemini can now do more intricate work inside Google Sheets. You can now request complex, multi-stage edits in a single prompt. This upgraded functionality is available now on qualifying accounts. Last month, Google Sheets picked up additional Gemini functionality , gaining the ability call on Google‚Äôs AI to do things like explain how formulas work and automatically correct errors in formatting. Today, Google‚Äôs announced that Gemini can now do even more in Sheets, carrying out increasingly complex tasks on your behalf. In a blog post, Google has shared that new Gemini integration in Sheets can automate actions that involve multiple discrete steps. You can now make longer, more complicated Gemini requests in Sheets to, for example, add a new column that populates with a formula dealing with inputs you define, or to add, delete, or rearrange columns, rows, and cells however you see fit.

title: Google confirms: Powerful ‚ÄòHelp me edit‚Äô tool is missing in some states
summary: Google confirms that conversational editing is blocked in these states.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google‚Äôs conversational photo editing tool is missing for users in Texas and Illinois. A PR representative for the company has confirmed that the feature is currently unavailable for users in these states. The reason could be due to the biometric data laws in Texas and Illinois. When Google launched the Pixel 10 series, it also debuted a conversational editing feature for the Photos app. Conversational editing is a Gemini-powered feature that allows you to edit images simply by entering a text or voice prompt. Last month, Google expanded the feature so other Android users in the US could begin trying it out. Although it‚Äôs now available on more Android devices, it‚Äôs still missing for users in two states. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Wallet is finally getting a home for your Play Points
summary: Wallet finally gets around to solving an overdue integration gap.
body: TL;DR The Google Play Store has implemented a Play Points loyalty system for earning discounts. So far, you‚Äôve managed your Play Points directly through the Play Store app. Now Google Wallet has started giving users the option to add Play Points as a loyalty card. Google Wallet is far more than just a place to keep your credit cards, and the app has evolved into a digital card hub that‚Äôs truly worthy of its name, carrying everything from travel passes to loyalty cards. That latter addition is one we‚Äôve seen the app been giving some special attention to this year, building out tools to help you keep them current and surface the right one at the right time . Now we‚Äôre learning about the latest loyalty card perk coming to Wallet, as the app begins supporting Google Play Points. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Have a legacy T-Mobile plan? You may qualify for this $830 ‚Äòany condition‚Äô trade-in credit
summary: Are you eligible? Read on to find out.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is reportedly running a new $830 ‚Äúany condition‚Äù trade-in offer (Promo R339) that began on October 2 and includes many older Android and iPhone models. The promo seems targeted mainly at legacy Simple Choice users, giving older plan holders a rare chance to qualify for a major deal. Unfortunately, it isn‚Äôt listed in the T-Life app for most users, and must be confirmed through a rep (call or text 611). T-Mobile might offer a wide range of phone deals and promotions, but most of the time, there are clear restrictions on who is eligible. Some deals require a higher-end plan to qualify, but nearly every offer requires at least a current entry-level plan. This usually means customers with older, legacy plans are left out in the dark. Thankfully, every once in a while, an offer comes along that even older plans like Simple Choice can take advantage of. According to several users on Reddit , some have been able to get in on a new $830 ‚Äúany condition‚Äù trade-in offer.

title: Two of your favorite streamers just announced a bundle that could save you money (Updated)
summary: Like Peacock? Like Apple TV Plus? We just found a new way to lower your bills.
body: TL;DR NBCU‚Äôs Peacock app now includes code referencing a still-unannounced Apple TV Plus bundle deal. While pricing is not yet available, the app promises savings over separate subscriptions. Users will have to manually cancel their existing subscriptions first if signed up through third parties. Update, October 16, 2025 (12:11 PM ET): We saw this one coming a couple weeks ago, and today Apple and NBCUniversal are making the bundle official: Starting October 20, you‚Äôll be able to subscribe to both Apple TV and Peacock Premium for just about $15 a month, or Apple TV and Peacock Premium Plus for $20. Original article, October 3, 2025 (11:04 AM ET): You‚Äôd be forgiven for wincing a little anytime you see the name of one of your favorite streaming services pop in a news feed, as how often is it good news? If it‚Äôs not upcoming shows being shelved over fears of upsetting just the worst people, it‚Äôs news of price hike after price hike driving up your monthly bills. Today we‚Äôd love to break from that pattern with some actual good news ‚Äî even if we don‚Äôt quite have all the salient details just yet.

title: Google Photos will make your life look more feed-friendly with new highlight templates
summary: It'll be easier than ever to make flashy highlight reels from your own content.
body: TL;DR We‚Äôve seen evidence that Google Photos is getting new templates for highlight videos. The templates include pre-selected captions and music. Templates aren‚Äôt available yet, but could roll out soon. Google Photos is picking up some new tricks to make it easier to create more expressive highlight videos. The app can already splice together clips around a certain theme to make short-form videos about your own life, and now, we‚Äôve found evidence that that capability is expanding. Experimenting with version 7.50 of the Google Photos app on Android, we managed to enable an updated version of the highlight video editor. This new iteration comes with a bunch of new templates that include pre-selected music, as well as the option to add custom text overlays.

title: Pixel Camera 10.1 rolls out Material 3 Expressive redesign [U]
summary: After debuting on the Pixel 10 (version 10.0), Google is rolling out the Pixel Camera 10.1 update to older devices with a handful of Material 3 Expressive tweaks. more‚Ä¶

title: OnePlus‚Äôs big OxygenOS 16 update brings much more than just Android 16: Here‚Äôs everything new
summary: OxygenOS 16 is based on Google‚Äôs Android 16 release, but OnePlus added a ton of new features on top.
body: When Google released Android 16 this past June, many users were disappointed by its lack of new features. Fortunately, the open nature of Android allows OEMs like OnePlus to add their own changes on top of Google‚Äôs releases. That‚Äôs exactly what OnePlus has done with its latest OxygenOS 16 update. It not only brings many of Android 16‚Äôs key features to OnePlus phones but also adds a host of additional features to improve your productivity, touch up your photos, make your phone feel faster, and more. Here‚Äôs everything new in OxygenOS 16! A new look and feel for OnePlus phones in OxygenOS 16 The biggest change in OxygenOS 16 is the new design. While not as extensive as Google‚Äôs Material 3 Expressive overhaul in Android 16, OxygenOS 16 is still a significant refresh. OnePlus divided the design changes into two categories: ‚ÄúBreathe With You‚Äù for visual refinements and ‚ÄúThrive with Free Expression‚Äù for new customization options.

title: Xiaomi commits to more rear displays after 17 series broke records
summary: Whether it‚Äôs just a trend or not, the rear display isn‚Äôt going away soon. Xiaomi clarified that the company is committed to improving the rear display panel with its next Android device. more‚Ä¶

title: Android Auto starts enforcing Android 9.0+ requirement
summary: After revealing the higher requirement over a year ago, Google has actually started enforcing that you‚Äôll need to be running Android 9.0 or higher to install the latest Android Auto updates. more‚Ä¶

title: Miss your Xperia Play? You need to see this magnetic sliding Bluetooth controller
summary: This viral Kickstarter controller is finally out of crowdfunding, and it looks incredible.
body: Credit: Ohsnap TL;DR MCON, a unique sliding mobile controller that attaches via magnets, is now available for purchase. It features TMR sticks, analog triggers, gyro controls, flip-out handles, an optional dock for external displays, and more. Initially funded via Kickstarter, it will be available later today to pre-order for $149.99 on the Ohsnap website. Mobile controllers have become more popular over the years as more controller-compatible Android games, emulators, and cloud gaming applications have hit the market. Most are simple telescopic controllers, but MCON is the first option in years with an entirely new design. With a look that harkens back to sliding handhelds like the PSP Go, Xperia Play, or even the recent ANBERNIC RG Slide , MCON attaches to the back of your phone via MagSafe magnets, then slides out with a spring-loaded ‚Äúswitchblade‚Äù mechanism in the back. This allows it to tuck away neatly when not in use, while still providing full-size controls when you need them.

title: Poll: Was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge?
summary: Is five months enough time to judge the success of a new flagship phone line?
body: Samsung took a swing at the thin-and-light smartphones category with the Galaxy S25 Edge , releasing the phone before Apple could release the iPhone Air . Shockingly, mere five months after its launch, reports suggest that Samsung has killed the Edge line . That means no further production of the Galaxy S25 Edge beyond existing stock, and no plans to launch its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. One can argue that five months is too short a period to judge the performance of a phone line. So, was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge? Reports suggest that the Galaxy S25 Edge sold only 1.31 million units since its launch in May, up to August. The first three months after launch are where most smartphone sales are concentrated, so this was seemingly enough of a runway for Samsung to assess the S25 Edge‚Äôs sales performance. In contrast, the Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra sold 8.28 million, 5.05 million, and 12.18 million units, respectively, as of August. Even the lowest-selling S25 Plus sold many times more than the Edge, but with the advantage of having launched earlier in the year.

title: Hate your phone‚Äôs camera island design? This flagship lets you swap it out like Lego
summary: And it's arriving next week in China, with a global launch to follow soon.
body: Credit: Realme TL;DR Realme just teased a key design element for the upcoming GT 8 Pro flagship. Its camera island can be swapped out for a different shape or color. The phone also features special color tuning by camera brand Ricoh and is realme‚Äôs first phone with a special partnership. Innovation is dead, one could easily argue in the context of phone designs. In addition to the glass slab becoming widely accepted as the standard design for a big chunk of smartphones made and sold today, the fast lane launches and the constant battle to uproot competition have led manufacturers to focus on other areas than design. At the same time, certain outliers, like Nothing, challenge that notion by experimenting with unusual camera designs , secondary displays , and unusually tiny screens . Now, another leading Android manufacturer is experimenting with a subtle change that can radically alter the phone‚Äôs look by altering how the camera appears. OnePlus‚Äô sister brand, realme, has just begun teasing its upcoming flagship with a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 . In addition to the new chipset, the realme GT 8 Pro is also the brand‚Äôs first phone to feature a camera developed in partnership with a ca‚Ä¶

title: Thanks Hasselblad: These 15 photos might be the best I‚Äôve ever taken with a phone
summary: Can the OPPO Find X9 Pro beat Apple and Google for title of best camera phone?
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kfZRRrBe9Qk This week, we‚Äôve spent some hands-on time with the upcoming OPPO Find X9 Pro flagship. It won‚Äôt be long until we can share our full initial impressions, but we can talk a bit about the new camera setup, and it‚Äôs certainly shaping up to be impressive. That‚Äôs not particularly surprising. I highly rate the Find X8 Pro ‚Äî my current daily driver ‚Äî in no small part for its stunning pictures. But OPPO plans to take things up a gear this year with a new 200-megapixel telephoto camera, co-developed with Hasselblad once again. The company also has a Hasselblad telephoto extender lens that takes the 200MP camera‚Äôs 3.3x zoom / 70mm focal length and blasts it up to a longer-range 9.6x zoom with an equivalent 230mm focal length. Paired with crops and upscaling from that huge 200MP camera, it can take photos all the way out to 40x (920mm).

title: I tested the zoom cameras on the Pixel 10 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro, and Google should be worried
summary: It turns out that top-end zoom doesn't always beat everyday reliability.
body: I‚Äôm not quite ready to draw my conclusions on the iPhone 17 Pro just yet ‚Äî essentially, whether it can finally pull me away from Android ‚Äî but I do know one thing: Apple is taking its still photography more seriously than ever. It‚Äôs added new Photographic Styles to the mix, reworked the camera app to give it a more straightforward interface, and finally upgraded its camera hardware with a significantly improved 4x telephoto sensor . Unsurprisingly, it has me reaching for the iPhone camera more than ever before, and it‚Äôs making me wonder whether the Pixel 10 Pro really has my favorite camera system. So, to settle things once and for all, I decided to put the two giants to the test. I set out to grab a series of snaps across some of the most common focal lengths to see if I really still liked Google‚Äôs processing the best. Here‚Äôs what I found.

title: Gboard‚Äôs upcoming Auto-switch feature could save you countless keystrokes
summary: Because typing ‚Äúit‚Äôs complicated‚Äù shouldn‚Äôt be complicated.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Gboard beta introduces an ‚ÄúAuto-switch after apostrophe‚Äù feature to enhance typing speed. Once the feature goes live, the keyboard will return to letters automatically after ‚Äò is pressed. The feature will likely support English, French, German, and several other languages upon launch. Typing apostrophes on Gboard is about to get a lot less tedious. According to the latest beta version of the app (v16.2.4.815623744), Google is working on a new feature called ‚ÄúAuto-switch after apostrophe‚Äù, which aims to make inserting apostrophes smoother and faster while typing. title: Roaming charges no more: Nomad‚Äôs eSIM keeps you connected, wherever you are
summary: Whether you're planning a quick vacation or an extended trip, Nomad eSIM helps you take care of your connectivity needs.
body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority It wasn‚Äôt that long ago that the horror of a bloated phone bill when traveling abroad meant that the first thing we did was disable data roaming, and to be extra safe, put our phones in airplane mode. Hotel Wi-Fi isn‚Äôt always reliable, and local SIM cards may be difficult to find or incompatible with your phone. Travel-friendly eSIMs have made these concerns a thing of the past. You no longer have to scramble to get a local SIM card. Instead, you can guarantee data connectivity even before you get on the plane. With seamless connectivity, easy setup, and affordable data plans, Nomad eSIM is one of the best in the business ‚Äî and now you can save 30% on Nomad eSIM plans with code NOM30 until 30 October 2025. Here‚Äôs what you need to know!

title: Google Photos is preparing to show up for Android XR‚Äôs big moment
summary: With dedicated features for immersive media, such as panoramas.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing new features in the Photos app for Android XR. We‚Äôre now seeing in action a ‚ÄúSpatial‚Äù tab with media suitable for XR headsets. It is also testing a ‚ÄúGo immersive‚Äù option, which may be used to cast images to the headset directly from your phone or convert 2D images into 3D. Google‚Äôs Android XR platform is set for its big debut, with Samsung‚Äôs Project Moohan, aka Galaxy XR , likely to be the first headset to feature the interface. Ahead of the release, Google can be seen tailoring standard Android apps to run in the expansive realm. Photos, Google‚Äôs suggested app for storing all media, especially what you capture yourself, is gearing up to photos and videos on a big canvas. title: Forget the Analogue 3D, this competing N64 FPGA console is ready for the spotlight
summary: The ModRetro M64 will be on display and fully playable for the public this weekend.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The ModRetro M64 will be playable this weekend at the Portland Retro Gaming Expo. The modern N64 FPGA device plays original N64 cartridges, plus many more via MiSTer cores. It may beat the Analogue 3D out of the gate, despite being announced more than a year later. The N64 is making a comeback, with two separate FPGA consoles set to arrive soon. The most recent contender, the ModRetro M64, will be playable for the first time at this weekend‚Äôs Portland Retro Gaming Expo. Announced via X , this will be the first official look at the M64 hardware. Several key details have been revealed over the past few months, including the fact that it will be capable of running MiSTer cores to emulate other consoles, but the physical hardware design is still a mystery. The announcement includes an illustration of the console, which looks fairly faithful to the original hardware.

title: Why Apple should be terrified if Gemini comes to macOS
summary: Make it happen, Google.
body: Google did something recently that I didn‚Äôt see coming from a mile away. While Google does make a few desktop apps (I swear it should be making many more), like Drive for syncing your folders , I never, in my wildest dreams, thought it would bring Search to Windows as a native app. But it did ‚Äî and how. The new Google Search app experiment on Windows looks like a one-stop solution for anyone more invested in Google‚Äôs ecosystem than Microsoft‚Äôs Copilot efforts. And seeing it in action as a Mac user, I don‚Äôt want to admit it, but I‚Äôm a bit jealous. Sure, Apple has Spotlight, but it‚Äôs still light on AI and lacks the best of what Google Search offers ‚Äî the features I actually use every single day.

title: This is why I stick with Google Pixel phones ‚Äî despite the weaker specs
summary: There's more to a phone than high-end specs.
body: As with every Google Pixel launch, this year‚Äôs Pixel 10 series has been no stranger to criticism, with much of it directed at the Pixel 10‚Äôs poor specs. Compared to flagships from Samsung, OnePlus, and others, there‚Äôs plenty to critique about the Pixel 10 and Pixel 10 Pro . The Pixel 10 lineup doesn‚Äôt stand out for its amazing battery life. Google isn‚Äôt pushing any boundaries with its wired charge speeds. And, perhaps the hottest point of contention, the Tensor G5 chip just isn‚Äôt as powerful as its Snapdragon and MediaTek rivals.

title: Nothing reveals the shocking cost of building a custom smartphone OS
summary: It's more than what the hardware of a flagship phone costs.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothing‚Äôs latest video with MrWhoseTheBoss breaks down what it really costs to build a smartphone OS from scratch. The team estimates a total cost of $40.47 million, higher than the approximate $26 million needed for flagship hardware. By using AOSP instead of starting from zero, Nothing saves time, money, and gains full access to Google‚Äôs ecosystem. Ever wondered what it takes to build a custom operating system from scratch? In its latest collaboration with YouTuber MrWhoseTheBoss, Nothing takes a closer look at what it truly costs to build a new operating system from the ground up. The video, which aimed to create a custom OS for Arun Maini, breaks down every stage of the process, from planning to deployment, and reveals that developing a fully functional mobile OS would cost an eye-watering $40.47 million. As the video highlights, that figure is even higher than the estimated $26 million it would take to produce the hardware of a flagship phone, as shown in the duo‚Äôs earlier Dream Phone project .

title: Breaking: Samsung has reportedly cancelled the Galaxy S26 Edge, here‚Äôs why
summary: To no one's surprise, the Galaxy S25 Edge sold significantly lower than expected.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR A new report from South Korea suggests Samsung has cancelled the ‚ÄúEdge‚Äù line due to significantly lower-than-expected sales. According to the report, there will not be a Galaxy S26 Edge. Instead, Samsung will stick to its tried-and-tested lineup of Galaxy S26 (Pro), S26 Plus, and S26 Ultra. A previous report had suggested that Samsung has already resumed development on the Galaxy S26 Plus. Samsung took a giant leap of faith with the Galaxy S25 Edge , a flagship smartphone that was ready to compromise on some core specifications in the pursuit of a thin and light body. The Korean company one-upped Apple before it could launch the iPhone Air , and even several other Android OEMs before they could jump onto the thin-and-light bandwagon. However, it‚Äôs no surprise that the Galaxy S25 Edge isn‚Äôt selling well, and the latest report out of South Korea indicates that Samsung has already canceled its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This new $999 de-Googled phone with a physical kill switch wants to take on Android‚Äôs best
summary: The HIROH Phone runs e/OS lets you kill the camera, mics, and connectivity options with one switch.
body: Credit: HIROH TL;DR The HIROH Phone is a privacy-focused device that runs e/OS and has a physical kill switch to restrict access to the camera, mics, and connectivity options. The smartphone is now available for pre-order in the US and will cost $999 when it launches early next year. It packs a 5,000mAh battery, a triple-rear camera setup, 16GB of RAM, and a MediaTek chipset. There‚Äôs a lot of talk about de-Googling these days. The movement essentially advocates cutting Google‚Äôs access to private information on people‚Äôs devices. That‚Äôs why many privacy-focused operating systems, like GrapheneOS , are gaining traction among users who want to avoid Google‚Äôs tracking and data collection and protect their information from reaching the wrong hands. Now, a new smartphone called the HIROH Phone is promising all those things, and it even adds a hardware kill switch for extra peace of mind.

It‚Äôs a big change, and thanks to YouTube‚Äôs virtual monopoly on traditional long-form video content, it‚Äôs something everyon‚Ä¶

title: Google is making it easier to find the right photo on your Android phone
summary: Google is updating the Android Photo Picker to add a handy date scrubber and voice search support.
body: TL;DR Google is updating Android‚Äôs Photo Picker with new features to make finding media easier. A new date scrubber lets you quickly navigate your gallery by jumping to a specific month. The search tool is also getting an update with a new voice search option for hands-free use. When you need to share a photo or video, Android‚Äôs Photo Picker lets you do so without granting an app access to your entire media gallery. It uses a simple, two-tab UI to help you selectively share media: the main ‚ÄúPhotos‚Äù tab displays your images in reverse chronological order, while the ‚ÄúCollections‚Äù tab shows any albums you‚Äôve created. However, finding the right image can be difficult if it‚Äôs not part of a collection. Fortunately, Google is introducing new features to make it easier. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

summary: This deal should end in two days, so sign up now!
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority If you want a foldable flip phone but would rather not pay the high prices they usually come with, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 FE is one of your best bets. And Samsung‚Äôs cheapest foldable is even cheaper right now! You can get the upgraded 256GB model at a record-low price of just $699. Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 FE for just $699 ($280.99 off)

title: Every new feature for Pixel phones in Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3
summary: The third beta of Android 16 QPR2 gives us an early look at the December 2025 Pixel Drop update.
body: The second quarterly release of Android 16 is coming in December, and it‚Äôll bring a whole host of new features to Pixel devices. Pixel users can expect features like auto-themed app icons, an expanded dark theme, icon shape customization, and much more. Since QPR2 is going to be a big update, Google is working to ensure it doesn‚Äôt bring a ton of new bugs, so the company rolled out a new beta today to find and fix them before release. Google rolled out Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 earlier today to all supported Pixel devices, from the Pixel 6 series to the new Pixel 10 series. In terms of changes, the update doesn‚Äôt bring as many new features as QPR2 Beta 1 or QPR2 Beta 2 , but it does still fix a ton of bugs and introduces a new security patch level.

title: Samsung pretends Galaxy phones have Qi2 with new magnetic wireless chargers [Gallery]
summary: Samsung has been stubborn when it comes to the updated wireless charging standard that is Qi2, with the new standard adding MagSafe-style magnetic charging outside of the iPhone ecosystem. Google became the first major brand to embrace Qi2 with the Pixel 10 series, and while Samsung is rumored to f‚Ä¶

title: Nothing Phone 3a users in the dark over Glyph light glitch
summary: Multiple users report a recurring Glyph light bug following the latest update.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro owners report a Glyph light that gets stuck on after the September update. Restarting the phone clears the issue, but it often returns. There‚Äôs no official fix yet, although one user was informed that a software update is being developed. Nothing‚Äôs signature Glyph lights are meant to be a handy visual accompaniment, but some Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro owners say they‚Äôre now refusing to turn off. Following the September update, multiple users have reported a persistent light that only disappears after rebooting the device. Across several Reddit threads, such as this one , this one , and this one , affected owners describe the same behavior: a main Glyph segment suddenly turns on and stays lit, ignoring normal controls in settings. A few users say it started after using the Essential Recorder feature, while others noticed it appearing without warning during calls or at a specific time of day. Restarting the phone clears it, but only temporarily.

title: Here‚Äôs everything new in Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 [Gallery]
summary: Android 16 QPR2 is a big quarterly update coming in December, with Beta 3 rolling out today for Pixel devices. more‚Ä¶

title: Nothing blames Apple patents for the lack of more phones with magnets for wireless charging
summary: Patents and red tape make for a lousy wireless charging landscape.
body: TL;DR Very few Android phones feature built-in magnets for wireless charging, while many more require a case with magnets. According to Nothing, patent restrictions prevent Android manufacturers from making phones optimally compatible with MagSafe. A company trying to develop its own compatible magnetic system could expect to invest $10M or more. Years and years after smartphones first started supporting it, wireless charging is having a moment. And it‚Äôs all Apple‚Äôs Qi2‚Äôs fault. At least, while we‚Äôve been able to drop phones on charging mats for ages, the convenience and efficiency of magnet-aligned wireless charging has only really taken off with the introduction of MagSafe accessories ‚Äî and now with the arrival of Qi2 25W, Android devices are finally starting to get in on the action. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Bitmoji in Gboard is officially on its way out
summary: The stickers will still exist, but they won't be directly accessible from Gboard.
body: TL;DR Gboard is losing its Bitmoji integration on December 15. We previously saw evidence this was coming in August. Bitmoji will still be accessible generally from its website and in other apps. Gboard provides quick access to GIFs and stickers to easily attach them in any app that allows it. One of the types of stickers the app currently supports is Bitmoji, little customizable cartoons that you can make look like yourself, right down to clothes and accessories. That integration won‚Äôt be around much longer, though. Earlier this year, we spotted code in the Gboard app that made it seem like Bitmoji support would be phased out before 2026. That change is drawing near: The app is now showing users a warning that clearly says Gboard‚Äôs Bitmoji integration is ending in just a few weeks.

title: Google releases the final beta for its next Pixel Drop: Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3
summary: Google has released the third and final beta of Android 16 QPR2 to Pixel devices ahead of the stable release in December.
body: TL;DR Google has released the third and final beta of Android 16 QPR2 to compatible Pixel devices. The update is available for the Pixel 6 series and later, and users can install it by enrolling in the Android Beta program and waiting for the OTA to roll out. Users who install the beta can‚Äôt return to the stable channel without a data wipe until the final update is released in early December. Following the stable release of Android 16 back in June, Google pushed out the first quarterly release last month and is now working on the second quarterly release. Although the second quarterly release of Android 16 won‚Äôt be released until December, Google is giving users the opportunity to beta test it now to find bugs and issues before the update is finalized. Today, Google released the third and final beta of Android 16 QPR2 to compatible Pixel devices. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Survey shows how many of you are still holding out hope for Google Home
summary: Your votes in our poll reveal how much patience is left for the smart home ecosystem.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority A smart speaker‚Äôs supposed to make life easier rather than drive you up the wall, but that‚Äôs what many Google Home owners have experienced over the past few years. Various glitches and broken routines have tested people‚Äôs patience, even among those who‚Äôve stuck by the platform from the start. Google‚Äôs hoping its big Gemini for Home upgrade and new hardware will turn things around, but after so many false starts, we wanted to know if people are willing to wait around for that revival. We polled our readers to find out. My colleague Karandeep Singh expressed his personal views on this recently, making his article the perfect place to run our poll. For his part, he admitted his loyalty to Google Home had finally run out. He explained how years of reliability issues and patchy updates had worn him down, and how learning that Gemini for Home won‚Äôt launch in India anytime soon was the final straw. Understandable as that is, his geospecific issue won‚Äôt apply to many of our readers, and the poll results below suggest that a majority of you are willing to roll the dice with Google‚Äôs smart home ecosystem at least one more time.

title: Ridiculous design, or your next must-have? This smartphone has a built-in camera gimbal
summary: Forget pop-up selfie cams; we're going next level!
body: TL;DR HONOR has published a teaser for its Robot Phone with a motorized camera gimbal. The gimbal folds up and tucks down behind a sliding panel on the rear camera island. HONOR intends to further show off the hardware at MWC next March. Feel like smartphone hardware has gotten too boring? Sure, we‚Äôve got foldables aplenty now, but what are your options if you want something a little off the beaten path from your handset? The Nothing Phone 3 with its little Glyph Matrix screen on the back? Today we‚Äôre checking out what‚Äôs maybe the most interesting, innovative attempt to do something a little radical with phone hardware that we‚Äôve seen in quite some time, with the teaser of handset featuring a built-in gimbal camera. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Android Auto isn‚Äôt losing access to its game collection after all
summary: Android Auto isn't losing GameSnacks, but it will lose support for Android Oreo.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A beta build indicates that Android Auto will drop support for Android 8.0/8.1. Google has fixed an issue where the GameSnacks app went missing for some Android Auto users. An update to the settings section has reduced the number of items you see at once. The color of the app icon in the header of the new media player UI changes based on the accent of the song. Earlier this month, some Android Auto users noticed that they were no longer able to access the GameSnacks app. There‚Äôs now an update on this situation. We have also spotted a handful of changes coming to Android Auto through an APK teardown of the 15.5 beta build. We‚Äôll quickly break down everything you need to know. title: Samsung‚Äôs new Qi2 chargers are ready before its phones are
summary: Two Qi2-certified wireless chargers for home and car, but you'll still need a magnetic case for the full experience.
body: Credit: Samsung TL;DR Samsung has launched two new Qi2-certified wireless chargers in the US, one for home use and one for the car. The Single Wireless Charger costs $34.99, while the Car Wireless Charger is $84.99. The chargers work with the latest Samsung flagships, but you‚Äôll need a magnetic case for the full Qi2 experience. Samsung just rolled out a pair of Qi2 wireless chargers in the US, bringing some significant upgrades to the line for 2025. The new Single Wireless Charger and Car Wireless Charger are both Qi2-certified and designed to work with Samsung‚Äôs latest flagships, provided you use a compatible magnetic case for the whole Qi2 experience. title: Your open-source custom ROM has a dirty secret, and Librephone wants to fix it
summary: New FSF effort could finally bring true privacy transparency to smartphones.
body: TL;DR Librephone is an effort to reverse engineer proprietary code needed for your phone to run. While projects like LineageOS prioritize open-source code, some binary ‚Äúblobs‚Äù have so far been necessary. The project will start by identifying a target handset with minimal proprietary code. Privacy is a big concern for a lot of smartphone users, and while platforms like Android offer oodles of different settings for managing your data and who gets access to it , at the end of the day you‚Äôre still placing your trust in Google. You‚Äôve got other options, though, with projects like GrapheneOS offering alternative firmware that doubles down on privacy while further minimizing your data‚Äôs exposure. And now we‚Äôre learning about a new effort that looks to address one of the biggest issues with open software projects like that. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: T-Mobile‚Äôs JUMP! On Demand program is shutting down, but there‚Äôs a silver lining
summary: Customers get one final upgrade before December 1.
body: TL;DR T-Mobile is ending its JUMP! On Demand lease plans on December 1. Existing subscribers can upgrade one final time through November 30. JOD subscribers will keep whichever phone they‚Äôre currently leasing when the program ends, at no additional cost. T-Mobile is no longer taking new JOD sign-ups, so this perk is only for established customers. T-Mobile launched a program branded JUMP! On Demand (JOD) back in 2015. JOD is a lease plan that allowed subscribers to swap their leased devices out as frequently as once a month ‚Äî an appealing proposition for folks who want to try out all the latest phones without spending thousands of dollars a year to do it. T-Mobile has announced that that plan is going away in a few weeks, but it‚Äôs offering subscribers a pretty decent consolation. As spotted by The Mobile Report , T-Mobile is ending the JOD program on December 1. But as T-Mobile spells out in support documentation, existing JOD subscribers will get to keep their current device when the plan goes away. The carrier will even waive any remaining lease payments.

Skywatching Highlights Transcript What‚Äôs Up for October? A Supermoon takes over, the Draconid meteor shower peeks th‚Ä¶
body: Skywatching Skywatching Home What‚Äôs Up Meteor Showers Eclipses Daily Moon Guide More Tips & Guides Skywatching FAQ Night Sky Network A supermoon, and meteor showers from the Draconids and Orionids A supermoon takes over the sky, the Draconid meteor shower peeks through, and the Orionid meteor shower shines bright. Skywatching Highlights Oct. 6: The October supermoon Oct. 6-10: The Draconid meteor shower Oct. 21: The Orionid meteor shower peaks (full duration Sept. 26 ‚Äì Nov. 22) Transcript What‚Äôs Up for October? A Supermoon takes over, the Draconid meteor shower peeks through, and the Orionid meteors sparkle across the night sky. The evening of October 6, look up and be amazed as the full moon is bigger and brighter because ‚Äì it‚Äôs a supermoon! Illustrated infographic showing the difference (as seen from Earth) between perigee, when a supermoon appears, and apogee, when a micromoon appears. NASA/JPL-Caltech This evening, the moon could appear to be about 30% brighter and up to 14% larger than a typical full moon. But why? Supermoons happen when a new moon or a full moon coincides with ‚Äúperigee,‚Äù which is when the moon is at its closest to Earth all month. So this is an exceptio‚Ä¶
